MANILA- The Philippines will buy 16 Black Hawk helicopters from the Sikorsky Aircraft Corp for P12.67 billion ($240 million), shunning cheaper Russian ...

item.title: Philippine Air Force picks Black Hawks, T129 ATAK choppers - INQUIRER.net
item.description:
Philippine Air Force picks Black Hawks, T129 ATAK choppers  INQUIRER.net

The Philippine Air Force's technical working group (TWG) has identified the combat utility and attack helicopters that have met its requirements to fulfill its ...

item.title: Air Force grounds Sokol choppers after helicopter crash landing in Tarlac - ABS-CBN News
item.description:
Air Force grounds Sokol choppers after helicopter crash landing in Tarlac  ABS-CBN News

The Philippine Air Force said Friday it has grounded all of its Sokol helicopters after a chopper carrying a lawmaker crash-landed in Tarlac.

item.title: Lawmaker, soldiers safe after chopper crashes in Tarlac - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Lawmaker, soldiers safe after chopper crashes in Tarlac  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, November 22) — A chopper bound for a military event crashed in Tarlac province on Thursday. The Philippine Air Force said 12 ...

item.title: Soldier's arm amputated after Tarlac chopper crash - ABS-CBN News
item.description:
Soldier's arm amputated after Tarlac chopper crash  ABS-CBN News

MANILA - Surgeons have had to amputate the right arm of a soldier who was injured when a Sokol chopper crash-landed in Tarlac, the military said Friday.

item.title: U.S., Turkey choppers selected for purchase by Philippine Air Force - CNN Philippines
item.description:
U.S., Turkey choppers selected for purchase by Philippine Air Force  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, December 7) — The Philippine Air Force (PAF) may soon have more combat utility and attack helicopters in its arsenal. Speaking to reporters Friday, Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said that the Air Force's technical working group (TWG) has already recommended two helicopter types for purchase: the U.S.-made Sikorsky Black Hawk combat utility helicopter and the Turkish T129 ATAK attack helicopter. "The PAF TWG has come up with recommendation that the Black Hawk is the best option that we will buy so we will pursue that," Lorenzana said. With President Rodrig...

item.title: The World Tonight: PH military denies outgoing air force chief axed for insubordination - ABS CBN News
item.description:
The World Tonight: PH military denies outgoing air force chief axed for insubordination  ABS CBN News

President Rodrigo Duterte named a new air force chief, replacing the former commander who was allegedly axed for insubordination. Subscribe to the ABS-CBN News channel! - http://bit.ly/TheABSCBNNews Visit our website at http://news.abs-cbn.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/abscbnNEWS Twitter: https://twitter.com/abscbnnews Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/abscbnnews #TheWorldTonight #ANCNews

item.title: New PAF commanding general named - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
New PAF commanding general named  SunStar Philippines

PRESIDENT Rodrigo Duterte has appointed Lieutenant General Rozzano Briguez as the new commanding general of the Philippine Air Force (PAF). Duterte approved Briguez's new appointment to the PAF effective December 5, according to a letter addressed to Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana. Briguez will replace Lieutenant General Galileo Gerard Kintanar, who is set to retire from the military service in January next year but opted for early retirement. A member of the Philippine Military Academy Class of 1986, Briguez served as head of the Armed Forces of the Philippines's (AFP) Western Command,...

item.title: PH to buy US helicopters, not Russian, due to sanctions: Lorenzana - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana. Mark Demayo, ABS-CBN News/ File MANILA- The Philippines will buy 16 Black Hawk helicopters from the Sikorsky Aircraft Corp for P12.67 billion ($240 million), shunning cheaper Russian equipment due to U.S. sanctions on Russian military exports, Defense Chief Delfin Lorenzana said Friday. The Philippines had initially agreed to buy 16 Bell 412 helicopters from Canada but the deal was scrapped in February after Canada expressed concern they could be used to fight rebels. The Philippines then considered several other helicopters including Sikorsky Aircraft's ...

item.title: Lawmaker seeks 'genuine' modernization of AFP - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Lawmaker seeks 'genuine' modernization of AFP  SunStar Philippines

THE party-list lawmaker who was among those aboard the military aircraft that crashed in Tarlac last week has called on the government to pursue a “genuine” modernization of the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP). Coop-Natcco Representative Anthony Bravo, in his privilege speech at the House of Representatives on Monday, November 26, said he had learned that the helicopter crash last November 22, which left him and 11 others injured, was not the first but the third incident involving Sokol helicopters of the Philippine Air Force. He said in August 2014, a Sokol helicopter carrying then 4...

item.title: Airstrike kills 2 soldiers, wounds 11 in Marawi - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Airstrike kills 2 soldiers, wounds 11 in Marawi  Sun.Star Philippines

A PHILIPPINE Air Force fighter jet missed its target in an airstrike Wednesday, July 12, against the Maute terror group in Marawi City, killing two soldiers who were hit by debris from a building where they were taking cover, military officials said. Eleven other soldiers were slightly wounded and taken to a hospital after being hit by shrapnel when the aircraft dropped its bomb about 250 meters (820 feet) from its target, military spokesman Colonel Edgard Arevalo said. It was the second deadly accident involving aerial bombing since the military launched an offensive to end an unprecedente...

item.title: Cebu City police chief named 2017 Cops finalist - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu City police chief named 2017 Cops finalist  Sun.Star Philippines

SENIOR Superintendent Joel Doria, the Cebu City Police Office (CCPO) director, is named finalist in the Country's Outstanding Police Office Officers in Service (Cops) of the 2017 Metrobank Foundation Outstanding Filipinos Search. The other finalists are Senior Police Officer 1 Steven Salaya of Iloilo City Police Office, Police Officer 3 Shiela May Pansoy of Digos City Police Station, Police Chief Inspector Rosalino Ibay Jr. of the Manila Police District, Police Senior Inspector Dennis Ebsolo of Cagayan De Oro City Police Office, and Police Superintendent Olivia Sagaysay of Sta. Mesa Police ...

item.title: PAF holds mall exhibit in SM Clark - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PAF holds mall exhibit in SM Clark  Sun.Star Philippines

ANGELES CITY -- The Philippine Air Force (PAF) kicked-off on Saturday, June 10, activities relative to its 70th anniversary celebration with the opening of a mall exhibit at SM Clark. Carrying the theme “PAF @ 70: Partnering For Change and Sustaining the Effort Towards a Jointly Engaged Transforming Force For Greater Peace and Security”, the exhibit seeks to showcase the state-of-the-art facilities, services and equipment of the service branch. “The activity serves as an avenue for the airmen and airwomen of the Air Force to educate and inform the public about its capabilities and mission,”...

item.title: Military won't bomb lumad schools – AFP - Rappler
item.description:
Military won't bomb lumad schools – AFP  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Armed Forces will not take as policy President Rodrigo Duterte's threat to bomb lumad schools without Department of Education accreditation. AFP spokesman Brigadier General Restituto Padilla said the President's threat was merely a strong style of messaging to emphasize his disdain for schools that "brainwash" children into hating government. "The bombing remark, it's just a style of communicating a tough stance and so many people will understand. But to actually do it (bomb), that won't happen," Padilla said in a mix of English and Filipino on Friday, July 28. "H...

item.title: PAF, OPAV to draft protocol for patient transport outside Cebu - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PAF, OPAV to draft protocol for patient transport outside Cebu  Sun.Star Philippines

REMEMBER the newborn baby Zyrus Gabriel Soringa who was diagnosed with pulmonary stenosis and has to be airlifted to Manila two days after he was born a week ago? He lost the battle with his illness but he left a legacy that will soon benefit those who have to be immediately transported to other parts of the country during emergency situations. Pierre Jabagat of the Office of the Presidential Assistant for the Visayas (OPAV) said they're now coming up with a protocol on how to handle a situation similar to Zyrus Gabriel. Jabagat was referring to the transport of patients who need to seek im...

item.title: PH Air Force now has 10 fighter jets - Rappler
item.description:
PH Air Force now has 10 fighter jets  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Now, the 5th batch. Two more FA-50 lead-in fighter trainers for the Philippine Air Force (PAF) arrived in Clark, Pampanga, on Wednesday, April 26. The FA-50s with tail numbers 009 and 010 touched down before noon on Wednesday. They bring the number of the Philippines' fighter jets to 10. They were officially received by PAF 1st Air Division commander Major General Enrique Reyes, said spokesman Colonel Antonio Francisco. The last batch to complete PAF's squadron of fighter jets is expected next month. They will be complete in time for PAF's anniversary celebration in Ju...

item.title: Perlas Spikers sit imports anew but prove strong enough to wallop struggling Air Force - SPIN.ph
item.description:
Perlas Spikers sit imports anew but prove strong enough to wallop struggling Air Force  SPIN.ph

IMPORT-less Perlas pounded Philippine Air Force, 25-23, 26-24, 25-13, in the Premier Volleyball League Reinforced Conference on Thursday at The Arena in San Juan. Team captain Dzi Gervacio led the way with 18 points for the Spikers, who still missed the services of Brazilian import Rupia Inck and Japanese reinforcement Naoko Hashimoto. Although Perlas received confirmation that their foreign players were cleared to play, Gervacio said that Inck and Hashimoto insisted not to play just to be safe as they wait for the confirmation from the FIVB and/or the AVC presidents. “Even if we had a conf...

item.title: 10 Philippine soldiers die in friendly-fire airstrike amid battle with Islamists - RT
item.description:
10 Philippine soldiers die in friendly-fire airstrike amid battle with Islamists  RT

Ten soldiers were killed and eight more injured after the Philippines Air Force mistakenly struck army positions in Marawi City partly occupied by Islamist militants, the defense minister said, adding that further airstrikes might be suspended. READ MORE: Duterte insists he ‘will not talk to terrorists’ in U-turn on clashes in south Philippines “A group of our military army men were hit by our own airstrikes... 10 killed and 8 wounded,” Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said in a statement to the media, as cited by Reuters. “The coordination was not properly done so we hit our own people.”...

item.title: Soldier, Air Force personnel's wife caught cheating - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Soldier, Air Force personnel's wife caught cheating  Sun.Star Philippines

CHARGES have been filed with the prosecutor’s office against a soldier and a government employee who were caught having an illicit affair inside a pension house in Zamboanga City, the police said on Wednesday, June 7. Superintendent Nonito Asdai, Police Station 6 chief, said charged for concubinage was Army Private First Class "James," 29; and, for adultery was "Claire," 38, an employee of the City Government. The charges against the two stemmed after they were arrested in one of the rooms of a pension house on Monday in the village of Tetuan. Asdai said the arrest came after "Claire’s" hus...

item.title: 3 killed in military helicopter crash in Tanay, Rizal - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
3 killed in military helicopter crash in Tanay, Rizal  Sun.Star Philippines

MANILA - A Philippine Air Force (PAF) pilot was killed along with his two crewmen while another one was injured when their combat utility helicopter crashed in Tanay, Rizal Wednesday. First Lieutenant Xy-zon Meneses, 2nd Infantry Division (2ID) Public Affairs Office chief, said the mishap happened 3 p.m., May 4, at Sitio Hilltop, Barangay Sampaloc, Tanay, Rizal. Meneses declined to identify the casualties pending the notification of their loved ones and families. Initial reports indicated that the helicopter had just finished conducting air-to-ground and disaster rescue operations training ...

item.title: Exclusive: Japan seeks Southeast Asia clout with chopper parts for Philippines military - sources - Reuters
item.description:
Exclusive: Japan seeks Southeast Asia clout with chopper parts for Philippines military - sources  Reuters

By Tim Kelly and Nobuhiro Kubo TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan's army will give thousands of helicopter parts to keep Philippine military choppers airborne, helping Tokyo gain clout with Manila in a contest with China to secure influence over the strategic South China Sea nation, four sources said. Military diplomacy is a new means for Japan to confound China's bid for control in the bitterly contested South China Sea as Prime Minister Shinzo Abe seeks a regional military role amid a retreat from decades of state pacifism. The pact could be the first in a series of similar deals as Tokyo cranks up ...

item.title: U.S. gives two surveillance planes to PH - CNN Philippines
item.description:
U.S. gives two surveillance planes to PH  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, July 28) — The U.S. government turned over on July 27 two surveillance planes to the Philippine Air Force (PAF) as part of efforts to boost our country's defense capability. These brand-new Cessna 208B planes will play a significant role in our military's maritime defense, as well as in its campaign against lawless and terrorist groups. Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said the planes can be used anywhere in the Philippines. "The range is malayo naman (It has a long range), including Marawi, Sulu Sea, including West Philippine Sea, including Benham Rise," Lo...

item.title: PH fighter jets redeployed in Marawi after air strike mishap - Rappler
item.description:
PH fighter jets redeployed in Marawi after air strike mishap  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The FA-50s of the Philippine Air Force (PAF) were redeployed in Marawi City against heavily armed local terror groups 3 weeks after an air strike mishap that killed two soldiers and wounded 11 others. "Ginamit na po muli natin ang FA-50 sa ating air strikes sapagkat base sa initial investigation na ating isinagawa wala pong fault na nakita sa eroplano o sa mga piloto," said Colonel Edgard Arevalo, chief of the Armed Forces of the Philippines Public Affairs Office. (We redeployed the FA-50 aircraft for our air strikes because based on initial investigation conducted, th...

item.title: 10 soldiers killed in botched government airstrike: military, defense officials - CNN Philippines
item.description:
10 soldiers killed in botched government airstrike: military, defense officials  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, June 1) — A government airstrike mistakenly killed 10 soldiers and wounded seven other troops in Marawi City on Wednesday, the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) said Friday. The AFP first placed the death toll at 11, but spokesman BGen. Restituto Padilla on Friday said, "we stand corrected." He clarified that the other soldier was killed in an encounter with the terrorists shortly after the Philippine Air Force's failed airstrike, which was part of its offensive to flush out remaining Maute fighters. Two light military aircraft trainer SF260TP jets were po...

item.title: BCDA, AFP to construct P70-M patrol road for Asean Summit - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
BCDA, AFP to construct P70-M patrol road for Asean Summit  Sun.Star Philippines

CLARK FREEPORT -- The Bases Conversion and Development Authority (BCDA) and the Clark International Airport Corporation (CIAC) signed an agreement with the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) for the construction of an 11.8-kilometer patrol road here in preparation for the upcoming 31st Asean Summit. Under the agreement, the AFP 51st Engineering Brigade and the 355th Aviation Engineering Wing of the Philippine Air Force will provide the manpower, labor, and the general construction equipment and tools for the project. CIAC was tasked to prepare the detailed engineering design and the peri...

item.title: Gov't assures full, impartial probe into Delos Santos' slay - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Gov't assures full, impartial probe into Delos Santos' slay  Sun.Star Philippines

MALACAÑANG on Wednesday assured United States Ambassador to the Philippines Sung Kim that there will be a full and impartial investigation into the killing of 17-year-old Kian Lloyd Delos Santos during an anti-drug operation in Caloocan City. Presidential Spokesperson Ernesto Abella made the assurance again after Kim joined the public outcry over the death of the Grade 11 student. On Tuesday, Kim took to Twitter his call for full accountability over the police drug operations in the country that led to the death of alleged drug suspects, including Delos Santos. "My condolences go out to the...

item.title: 2 mark lead in men’s world - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 mark lead in men’s world  Sun.Star Philippines

FOR most people, the Philippine Air Force and the Philippine National Police are worlds where only men rule, but two women in uniform are calling the shots in these forces. Maj. Florianne Reyes flies a nomadic aircraft and is one of 20 female pilots working at the Air Force base in Lapu-Lapu City. Police Senior Insp. Arieza Otida, on the other hand, heads Police Station 8, making her the only female police chief among the 11 police stations in Cebu City. But behind the uniforms and the badges were then young daughters who chose to set aside their own dreams to fulfill their respective paren...

item.title: Bunye: Remembering President Ramon Magsaysay - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Bunye: Remembering President Ramon Magsaysay  Sun.Star Philippines

SIXTY years ago last Friday, the President who is well-loved as a "Champion of the Masses" met his untimely death when his presidential C 47 plane crashed on Mt. Manunggal, Balamban, Cebu. President Ramon Magsaysay had just spent a very busy day in Cebu -- speaking in four universities, talking separately with Cebuano political leaders, greeting religious leaders, and conducting his usual “unscheduled” inspections. One report said he even managed to squeeze in some time to deliver a much needed package of medicines for a patient -- a certain Cornelio Faigao -- who was suffering from a rare ...

item.title: In Bicol, military spearheads relief drive for Marawi - Rappler
item.description:
In Bicol, military spearheads relief drive for Marawi  Rappler

LEGAZPI CITY, Philippines – The Armed Forces of the Philippines in Bicol is knocking on the doors of Bicolanos to gather aid for Marawi evacuees affected by the ongoing conflict in Mindanao. Army Colonel Alden Juan Masagca, commanding officer of the Army’s 901st Infantry Brigade, personally appealed over local radio for donations of used clothing, cash, kitchen utensils, food, and school supplies for Marawi evacuees in temporary government shelters. “To our kababayans in Bicol, we are knocking on your doors to solicit any assistance you can share to our brothers Marawi City in Mindanao affe...

item.title: 40 teams take part in Dragonboat fiesta - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
40 teams take part in Dragonboat fiesta  Sun.Star Philippines

THE first-ever Cebu Dragon Boat Fiesta will officially start today with the best teams coming to compete in the 2-day competition in Cebu Yatch Club in Lapu-Lapu City. There will be more than 1,000 paddlers from more than 40 teams who will be competing in the Philippines’ biggest dragon boat competition. The teams will be competing in 10 events on the 250-meters and 500-meter small boat and long boat competitions. The divisions include the Elite, Mixed Masters, women’s and club crew Open. Joining in the elite division are Philippine Air Force, Coast Guard, Philippine Navy and Philippine Arm...

item.title: 3 dead, 1 hurt in Rizal chopper crash - Rappler
item.description:
3 dead, 1 hurt in Rizal chopper crash  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – A military chopper crashed in Tanay, Rizal, Thursday afternoon, May 4, killing 3 and wounding another. The Philippine Air Force Huey – a UH-1D model – crashed around 3 pm in Sitio Hilltop, Barangay Sampaloc in Tanay. First Lieutenant Xy-zon Meneses, spokesman of the military's 2nd Infantry Division responsible over the area, said they would not name the victims until after their families had been informed. Soldiers and cops were holding joint training exercises to improve the country's capability to respond to disasters when the chopper had trouble as it prepared to l...

item.title: Cops lauded for passing drug test - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cops lauded for passing drug test  Sun.Star Philippines

NOT A single member of the Police Regional Office–Cordillera (PRO-Cor) tested positive for illegal drugs. This was reiterated by PRO-Cor regional director Chief Superintendent Elmo Francis Sarona during a Philippine National Police celebration in Camp Bado Dangwa, while reiterating gratitude to all stakeholders who contributed to the success of the war against drugs in the region. “We continue to deploy more uniformed police personnel who are now visible in the streets and the campaign against crime and lawlessness will remain to gain ground. We will not stop to go after those criminals in ...

item.title: 86 families in Davao City flee after military, NPA clash - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
86 families in Davao City flee after military, NPA clash  Sun.Star Philippines

A TOTAL of 86 families were displaced and forced to evacuate after a firefight erupted between the government troops and the members of New People's Army (NPA) in Barangay Dominga, Calinan District, Davao City Wednesday dawn, May 10. Captain Alenel Valles, Civil Military Operations (CMO) Officer of the 3rd Infantry Battalion, told SunStar Davao that the encounter happened at around 1 a.m., Wednesday, May 10, while the military forces were conducting clearing operations at that time and clashed with an undetermined number of communist rebels. At 4 p.m., Wednesday, the encounter is still ongo...

item.title: Cebu Pacific to give airlift support to wounded soldiers, cops - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu Pacific to give airlift support to wounded soldiers, cops  Sun.Star Philippines

CLARK FREEPORT -- Cebu Pacific Air will provide airlift support to military and police personnel wounded in action in Marawi City, Lanao del Sur. The wounded troops will also get baggage allowance of up to 40 kilograms. In cooperation with the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) and the Philippine National Police (PNP), this initiative aims to augment air support by the Philippine Air Force by helping move wounded government troops from field hospitals in the area to larger medical facilities of the AFP and PNP. Through this, field medical stations can be declogged, giving way for wounded...

item.title: ASEAN Summit Sidesteps China Threat - VOA News
item.description:
ASEAN Summit Sidesteps China Threat  VOA News

Leaders from 10 Southeast Asian countries at this week’s Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) summit in the Philippines have sidestepped criticizing China over its expansion in the contested South China Sea, a sign, some analysts say, of Beijing’s economic and diplomatic influence. ASEAN heads of state who conclude the four-day summit in Manila Saturday have, so far, issued no criticism of China. Analysts and media reports earlier in the week expected a mildly worded statement without naming any one country as a troublemaker. Nothing provocative Any slight against China, such as a...

item.title: PH Air Force gets weapons from U.S. - Rappler
item.description:
PH Air Force gets weapons from U.S.  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Air Force (PAF) has received weapons and munitions from the United States, “part of a series of upcoming transfers” from the US military that would help government forces in their war on terror, the US embassy in Manila said on Saturday, July 29. The US embassy said in a statement that officials from the Joint United States Military Assistance Group (JUSMAG) recently delivered 1,040 2.75-inch rocket motors and 992 2.75-inch rockets to the PAF through the Mutual Logistics Support Agreement (MLSA). “These timely transfers greatly enhance the Armed Forces o...

item.title: New terms for renewing Clark locators set - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
New terms for renewing Clark locators set  Sun.Star Philippines

CLARK FREEPORT -- Locators, who will be renewing their lease contracts will face new terms and conditions, said an official of the state-run Clark Development Corporation (CDC). CDC Chairman Jose de Jesus and President Noel Manankil, at the regular Friday, May 19, forum of the Capampangan in Median Inc. (CAMI) at the Bale-Balita in Pampanga, said the new terms could mean higher lease rates and rental fees, among others. De Jesus said that the affected locators have already been informed and assured about their security of tenure as long as they comply with rules and regulations of the state...

item.title: PH set to acquire Pohang-class corvette from South Korea - Rappler
item.description:
PH set to acquire Pohang-class corvette from South Korea  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippines is set to acquire one of the decommissioned Pohang-class corvettes of the Republic of Korea Navy, likely to be delivered within the year, to boost the country's capability to patrol its vast waters. "We have sent a letter to the government of South Korea expressing our intent to acquire one Pohang-class corvette. We are hoping to receive the vessel within the year," said Arsenio Andolong, chief of the Department of National Defense Public Affairs Office. The Pohang-class corvettes are patrol gunboat ships. Andolong said the type and configuration of the...

item.title: Response team formed for Asean meetings - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Response team formed for Asean meetings  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Emergency Preparedness and Response Office in Region 7 has created the National Incident Management Team to provide security to delegates of Asean (Association of Southeast Asian Nation)-related meetings. This is under the operational control of the Office of the Civil Defense (OCD). The meetings started yesterday and will end on July 8. Major Cyrus Neoman dela Cruz, who manages the team, said their task covers the overall emergency preparedness and response of the Asean meetings. Dela Cruz said that under their structural framework, they have already completed the postings of 18 person...

item.title: PAF chief wants probe on military helicopter crash in Tanay, Rizal - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PAF chief wants probe on military helicopter crash in Tanay, Rizal  Sun.Star Philippines

MANILA -- Philippine Air Force (PAF) Chief Edgar Fallorina ordered an investigation to determine the exact cause of the crash of the combat utility helicopter in Tanay, Rizal that killed three of his men and severely wounded another on Thursday, May 4. Fallorina ordered the immediate grounding of the remaining five UH-1D helicopters in PAF service following the crash at Sitio Hilltop, Barangay Sampaloc at about 3 p.m. of May 4. READ: 3 killed in military helicopter crash in Tanay, Rizal “The PAF has already sent a probe team to conduct a thorough investigation of the accident, as well as to...

item.title: Philippine Military Kills 11 of Its Soldiers in Errant Airstrike - The New York Times
item.description:
Philippine Military Kills 11 of Its Soldiers in Errant Airstrike  The New York Times

Seven others were injured as the government struggled to take back the southern city of Marawi from insurgents inspired by the Islamic State, officials said.

item.title: MJC, Navy spikers in men’s final - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
MJC, Navy spikers in men’s final  Sun.Star Philippines

MJC and the Philippine Navy spikers face each other in the final after beating their respective semifinal foes in the 1st Cagayan de Oro Fiesta Volleyball men’s open on Sunday night, August 27, at the Nazareth gym, Cagayan de Oro City. Both teams figured in a thrilling deciding set en route to barging into the men’s final showdown, still in progress as of this writing. Against the high-flying Philippine Air Force, the MJC spikers looked like having a bit advantage in the first set as the Airmen were just coming from a lung-busting tussle with Good Health in the quarterfinals. But the Airmen...

item.title: Outstanding Eastmincom soldiers feted - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Outstanding Eastmincom soldiers feted  Sun.Star Philippines

PRESIDENT Rodrigo Duterte awarded outstanding soldiers for their dedication to protect communities against lawless elements, urging them to stay on their toes during the 11th Eastern Mindanao Command (Eastmincom) founding anniversary on Friday, September 1. "I congratulate Eastmincom as it celebrates its 11th founding anniversary. May you always be mindful of your role as partners for real change and development in Eastern Mindanao which is aptly echoed on the theme of your anniversary,” Duterte said. Awards were given to Second Lieutenant Dennis Cortejo, Private First Class Alex Gocela Jr....

item.title: Duterte honors Air Force men, women - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Duterte honors Air Force men, women  Sun.Star Philippines

CLARK AIR BASE -- President Rodrigo Duterte on Tuesday, July 4, led the conferment of awards to outstanding individuals and units of the Philippine Air Force (PAF) during its 70th anniversary held at the Haribon Hangar here. The event was dubbed "Partnering for Change and Sustaining the Effort towards a Jointly Engaged Transforming Force for Greater Peace and Security." The President presented the awards to units, officers, enlisted personnel and civilian personnel of PAF, who have rendered meritorious and exceptional achievements to the country and to the Filipino people. The said awards s...

item.title: Air Force flies sick infant to Manila - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Air Force flies sick infant to Manila  Sun.Star Philippines

HERCULES and Anna Jucel Soringa are optimistic that their 3-day-old baby will survive his condition. The boy is suffering from a heart ailment. Zyrus Gabriel, the couple’s third child, was born with pulmonary stenosis, a condition characterized by obstruction of blood flow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary artery of the heart. The obstruction is caused by narrowing of one or more points from the right ventricle to the pulmonary artery. A day after he was born last June 28 at Cebu Doctors’ Hospital, Zyrus Gabriel had to be flown to Philippine General Hospital in Manila to undergo sur...

item.title: PH Navy gets radar system from U.S. - Rappler
item.description:
PH Navy gets radar system from U.S.  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The United States donated a tethered aerostat radar system (TARS) to the Philippine Nay to boost its capability to monitor maritime and air traffic amid continuing concerns in the West Philippine Sea (South China Sea). Philippine Navy spokesman Commander Lued Lincuna said a formal turn-over ceremony is scheduled on Tuesday, August 22, a month after the radar system arrived in the Philippines, based on photos that circulated online in July. Navy chief Vice Admiral Ronald Mercado and the US embassy's Deputy Chief of Mission Michael Klescheski are expected to attend the c...

item.title: Military to heed Duterte's order to take over Customs - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Military to heed Duterte's order to take over Customs  SunStar Philippines

THE Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) is ready to follow the order of President Rodrigo Duterte, its commander-in-chief, to temporarily take over civilian functions at the highly corrupt Bureau of Customs (BOC). Whether the move is legal or constitutional is a question best left to Malacañang, AFP spokesperson Brigadier General Edgard Arevalo said Tuesday, October 30. Arevalo said the AFP is taking “cognizance” of the order of the President. “’Yung question ng constitutionality and legality I would like to leave that to the President’s spokesperson. The AFP is just responding to the man...

item.title: Tracksters shine - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Tracksters shine  SunStar Philippines

FORMER Davao City track stars continue to shine in the Big City after collecting gold, silver and bronze medals in the just-concluded 2018 AFP-PNP Olympics athletics competition at the PhilSports Complex in Pasig City. The Philippine Army amassed a total of 327 points to rule the competition over Philippine Air Force (326), Philippine Coast Guard (95) and Philippine National Police (94) who grabbed the next three places. Private First Class (PFC) Criselyn Jaro, who used to play for Brokenshire College, helped PA win the women's 4X400-meter relay gold medal on top of sweeping silvers in wome...

item.title: Commission on Appointments approves promotion of 74 military officers - Rappler
item.description:
Commission on Appointments approves promotion of 74 military officers  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Commission on Appointments on Wednesday, October 10, confirmed the promotion of 74 senior officers of the Armed Forces of the Philippines. Initially, there were only 70 names on the list but the CA committee on national defense reconsidered 4 others after submitting an explanation. “They submitted a written explanation, may kasamang (together with) legal opinion and their interpretation of existing laws – Presidential Decrees and Republic Acts. When I perused sa sinubmit nila sabi ko (what they submitted, I said) I’m inclined to agree with their position,” said CA...

item.title: AFP, PNP ensure preparedness for Typhoon Ompong - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
AFP, PNP ensure preparedness for Typhoon Ompong  SunStar Philippines

THE Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) and Philippine National Police (PNP) have assured the public that they are prepared to assist and respond to calamities especially in areas expected to be battered by Typhoon Ompong (Mangkhut). Ompong, as of 10 a.m. Friday, September 14, was moving closer to the country with maximum sustained winds of 205 kilometers per hour (km/h) near the center and gusts of up to 255 km/h. It was expected to make landfall in Cagayan-Isabela area on Saturday morning, September 15. Lieutenant General Emmanuel Salamat, commander of the military’s Northern Luzon Comm...

item.title: Oro fans ‘smitten’ by Myla Pablo’s mystique - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Oro fans ‘smitten’ by Myla Pablo’s mystique  SunStar Philippines

MYLA Pablo’s non-threatening looks on the court gradually turned into something a mystique the adoring volleyball fans of Cagayan de Oro have warmly embraced. Suspecting she was injured after non-action in the first two sets when the Philippine Army bounced back from a crushing first set loss to level the score, the 24-year-old marketing graduate from National University came out from the bench in the third set to her fans’ great delight. Pablo started tentative and quite passive on defense that allowed the women’s army to score two-straight points. But when it mattered most, when she flexe...

item.title: Asian Games gold medalist Hidilyn Diaz receives Air Force promotion - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Asian Games gold medalist Hidilyn Diaz receives Air Force promotion  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, August 29) — Hidilyn Diaz was promoted by the Philippine Air Force as a sergeant after giving pride and honor to the country in the 2018 Asian Games. The Air Force gave Diaz a hero's welcome on Wednesday, exactly a week since she carried 207 kg to bag the gold medal in the 53 kg division of the women's weightlifting competition in the regional sports meet. "It's overwhelming how my PAF family welcomed me here. Sana maiuwi ko ang medalyang minimithi natin sa Olympics," Diaz said. Prior to her promotion, Diaz had the rank of airwoman first class. Joining Diaz we...

item.title: Oro ladies make gracious exit - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Oro ladies make gracious exit  SunStar Philippines

THEY may be out of the Higalaay Festival Volleyball Open’s moneyed circle, but the Cagayan de Oro volleybelles certainly made a mark among the local fans and their more illustrious counterparts from other places taking part in the cash-rich event fully-supported by City Mayor Oscar Moreno. For one, Team CDO made a respectable finish in the elimination round with two wins against a single defeat. Anchored by Manila-based coach Roger Gorayeb and former San Sebastian Lady Stag and 3-time NCAA Most Valuable Player Grethcel Soltones in the equally-talented Jorelle Singh, the CDO spikers fought t...

item.title: Duterte: China should temper its behavior in disputed waters - The Associated Press
item.description:
Duterte: China should temper its behavior in disputed waters  The Associated Press

MANILA, Philippines (AP) — The Philippine president said Tuesday that China's claim to airspace above newly built islands and surrounding waters in the disputed South China Sea "is wrong" and Beijing should not tell others to leave those areas to avoid possible clashes. President Rodrigo Duterte's remarks in a speech to an audience that included the American ambassador and other foreign guests were a rare public criticism of China, which he has refused to antagonize to nurture closer relations. "They have to rethink that, because that would be a flashpoint someday and even, you know, warnin...
